answer: Tony and I went over to Bal Harbour. Did a little shopping. Tony comes back, a smile playing across his lips. Frank watches near the entrance.

question: We were worried. You know you're not supposed to do that. Frank and Rachel look at each other.
answer: Farmer, you work here! Do you understand that? You work for me.

question: I'm gonna check the route. As usual. He opens the front door. A uniformed guard is standing outside. Frank goes out and closes the door.
answer: Did Fletcher call? Devaney, staring after Frank, shakes his head "no."

question: Gomez! Louis Gomez! He waits impatiently. No one comes. Two quick steps and he is back at the CRATES, throwing them violently into the corner where they CLATTER loudly to the floor. Frank walks on along the corridor. What are you doing? Move it. The Enormous Cuban gets slowly up from the boxes. He towers over Frank. I'm sorry. Frank steps away, rubs a hand through his hair, tries to collect himself. He's standing amidst dumpsters and discarded food boxes. He looks up and sees a marquee.
answer: Fletcher? No response. Baby, is that you? It's mommy, honey.

question: I'm through. I'll get you back to L.A. and that's it. The guy with Fletcher can cover you till you get a replacement.
answer: She got another call, while you were downstairs and she answered it herself. It was him, Frank. Same guy.

question: I don't care.
answer: Farmer, it really shook her up. She thought it was going to be Fletcher calling her from L.A. I think she'll be reasonable now.

question: Save it, Devaney. The people who hire me don't have to be convinced to save their own lives. Frank reaches the sliding door that leads to the balcony. Call me when she's ready to go down.
answer: Farmer -- Frank goes out on the balcony and slides the door closed behind him.

question: Just one.
answer: That's going to protect us?

question: He's a trained noisemaker.
answer: Terrific.

question: Katherine had this place organized just the way she wanted it. Frank's momma. There's the COUGH and SPUTTER of an outboard MOTOR from outside. Rachel looks from the kitchen window and sees Fletcher and Frank in the small skiff by the dock. Fletcher tugs again on the starter cord. At the third tug he tumbles backwards onto the seat.
answer: Fletcher doesn't swim well.

question: I guess he'd better stay in the boat then. Frank tells me you're a singer.
answer: That's right.

question: I'm afraid we're a little out of touch here. I'm sorry. Rachel waves this off. You must be very successful to need Frank. Rachel smiles and looks out of the window.
answer: It's so quiet here.

question: Every time. In the distance, Rachel and Fletcher have just reached the house where Nicki scoops up Fletcher and spins him round and round in a circle. She hugs him close and kisses his hair. After a few moments, Fletcher squirms free and runs to catch up with Rachel. Portman sometimes had trouble remembering what his job was. Supper's ready. We can see from Rachel's face that she feels embarrassed about her behavior in Miami.
answer: ... And I never hit him. Ever. To this day. That's true, isn't it? That's very unusual for my people. So what happens? When he's ten years old, he complains about it? Can you believe that?

question: Oh, for Chrissake! I'm going to tell her about the time you stripped in court.
answer: I don't care. I'm proud of that. Anyway, he's ten years old and he's just started playing tackle football. He comes to me and tells me he's afraid of getting hit, right? And he thinks it's because I never hit him. 'Why don't you ever hit me?' he says to me!

question: If you're lucky, maybe he'll tell you about my first jockstrap. As he speaks, he peers out through the window at the lake. We hear Herb's voice continue from the other room.
answer: He got over it His mother was the same way. Rachel smiles at him, thinking, then looks through at Frank in the kitchen, still peering out of the windows. Nicki watches Rachel. Come on, son, you can run but you can't hide. Herb pulls up a chair and smiles as Frank appears from the kitchen, a bowl of popcorn in his hand. Frank takes a place across from his dad by the fire. The others gather round. Your move. Frank studies the board. Rachel lowers her head into a cupped hand, fascinated.

question: You're very thorough. What's happening between you and Rachel? Frank glances at her. Come on. One minute she's got magnetic hands, the next she hates you. I can't figure out what it is now.
answer: You follow all her moves this closely?

question: It's a living.
answer: No, it isn't. He moves away into the next room. She hesitates a moment, then follows.

question: You think my life is pretty sickly, don't you?
answer: No.

question: You must. I do. Frank steps into a tight, dark, little window alcove, checks the windows.
answer: Why don't you change it?

question: Is it that easy? Frank turns from the window to find Nicki blocking his exit. She moves close to him and kisses him, her hands on his shoulders. The kiss ends and they look at each other.
answer: You're a lovely woman.

question: But you don't want me. I'm surprised. Thorough fellow like you. Why stop at one sister when you can fuck them both?
answer: I make my mistakes.

question: But you didn't say no to the boss. She starts to turn away from him, but his hands are on her now, holding her close, refusing to let her turn away. Their faces are very close. It is tight and near here.
answer: No, don't go away, Nicki. Don't leave me with that. Tell me about it. Tell me how long you've been second. Tell me how she has a child and you don't. Tell me something. But don't turn away and try to stick it on me. Nicki twists in his grip. He holds her tight.

question: I don't need this from you.
answer: Maybe I need it. I'm fed up with people telling me they have no control over their lives. If you hate your life so much, turn it around.

question: It's not so simple.
answer: Yes it is. You can walk out that fucking door anytime you want. I'll unlock it for you.

question: Let me go. He releases her, looks at her.
answer: Okay. It's not my business. He moves away, OUT OF FRAME. We HOLD ON Nicki, a long time. Raccoon... deer...? Herb nods. Their attention is drawn to soft singing up by the house.

question: Back off. Henry moves away from the van. Frank inserts the key in the ignition.
answer: Frank! Henry turns and motions to Herb to stay away. Someone's cut the phone lines. It could be anywhere between here and town.

question: Both the cars are dead. And I can't see how it was done. Frank and Herb exchange a look. Who could know we're here? This place has nothing to do with her.
answer: Maybe it has to do with you. Frank looks at him. We can't walk out of here at night with them. Frank shakes his head.

question: We'll button down tonight and walk out at first light.
answer: I was an idiot last night. There is a long pause. What do you think about today?

question: I think this is no maniac. He knows what he's doing. There is a long, long silence. Nicki continues crying. Finally --
answer: You're right. He does.

question: Tell me about it. She doesn't reply. Who is it, Nicki?
answer: He almost got Fletcher today...

question: How do we stop him?
answer: ...my darling Fletcher...

question: Who is it? You can call him off.
answer: He doesn't even know who hired him. He doesn't know who I am and I don't know who he is.

question: How'd you do it? How?
answer: ...I went to a bar in East L.A. I asked around... I talked to a man...

question: Name?
answer: ...Armando... He arranged it. That's all I know...

question: Is it all paid for?
answer: ... and then some... Till it's done.

question: He keeps going until he kills her? Nicki nods again, lowering her face into her hands. What's the name of the bar?
answer: I'm not sure... I was very stoned.

question: How 'bout the letters?
answer: No, no. You don't understand. The letters came first. I don't know who's sending them... but they're reading my mind... Those were my thoughts. I hate her. It made me think I could do it... But I could never hurt Fletcher. Never. You've got to stop it!

question: We will. You and me. Tomorrow we're going back to L.A. We're going to find the bar, we're going to find Armando. He starts to rise. She stops him.
answer: Don't you even want to know why?

question: You told me. She has everything. Frank stands up and begins to move across the room. Nicki puts her face in her hands and is silent for one moment. Suddenly, Frank freezes, listening.
answer: What if we can't -- Frank motions her into silence. We strain to hear what Frank hears. Silently, Frank goes to the door, crouch ing. He listens. There again is a DISTANT GROWL from the DOG upstairs. Frank lifts his gun from the table, turns to Nicki.

question: But, Frank, this doesn't make sense...
answer: What do you mean?

question: We already got him.
answer: What? Where?

question: Here, last night. You should see his locker, Frank. The guy's obsessed with Rachel Marron...
answer: You're sure it's him?

question: Forensics say it's 100 percent positive I.D... And he's got a black Toyota 4 x 4. Ray's with him now.
answer: Well, whoever you got down there wasn't here last night. This was a professional...

question: This is crazy... What do you want to do, Frank?
answer: How long can you keep him?

question: You okay, Frank? Frank acknowledges Fletcher's small presence standing to the side of the big chair. He doesn't look at him directly.
answer: Yeah, Fletcher, I'm okay. How 'bout you?

question: I couldn't sleep... It was so scary, just thinking about it... He looks at Frank. Do you feel scared, Frank?
answer: Yeah, Fletcher, I do. Everybody's afraid of something, Flethcer. That's how we know we care about something, when we're afraid we'll lose it.

question: What are you afraid of?
answer: I think you should try to go back to sleep now, pal.

question: Tell me, Frank, please. Is it the man who killed Nicki? Are you afraid of him? Finally, Frank turns and looks at Fletcher. Frank is pretty far gone. He shakes his head "no." He realizes that that kind of fear had never occurred to him, and recognizing that fact sets him back into his thoughts. Then what? What are you afraid of? Frank doesn't have the will to resist anymore. He lets his hand drop away from Fletcher.
answer: I'm afraid... of not being there... Fletcher stares at him, uncomprehending. It's late. Do you want me to take you back to your room? Fletcher shakes his head "no," just barely. Then he disappears.

question: I'm afraid... of not being there... Fletcher stares at him, uncomprehending. It's late. Do you want me to take you back to your room? Fletcher shakes his head "no," just barely. Then he disappears.
answer: You, you, you... You brought this pain into my house... Now you're here! Where were you then? Why didn't you save her? It was your job to protect me and she died doing it... It was me they were after. And you let them kill her! She never did anything to anyone. As she loses the strength and the will to hit him, her blows become sloppy, weak. She sinks to the steps, sitting on them, sobbing. She never hurt anyone. She was good. You saw her. She never wished anyone any harm. Did she? Did she? Frank looks at her, shakes his head "no." Rachel puts her head in her hands and is silent for a few moments; her crying slows. She never hurt a soul. ... I didn't love her well enough. I didn't take care of her... ... She gave me only love. I guess you've heard what's happening. Frank nods. Mind if I sit down? Frank shakes his head. They sit side by side for awhile, both lost in thought. Rachel seems very calm. It isn't over yet, is it? Frank shakes his head.

question: He knows he still hasn't got you.
answer: So he'll come again?

question: It's possible.
answer: The Oscars?

question: Maybe. Rachel takes this philosophically. She tugs at the grass, thinking.
answer: When I was back in Squirrel Hill, I started betting my friends fifty bucks each that someday I'd win an Oscar. You can understand how important it is that they see me up there if I win. She looks at him and smiles. If everyone of those pikers comes through, it could add up to a lot of money.

question: I think it's very dangerous.
answer: I know. But I can't stay up here on my hill forever. They are silent for awhile. Rachel lies back on the grass, stares at the sky. I didn't get to this place in my life by doing the smart thing every time. How 'bout you, Frank Farmer? Out there on the edge... did you ever do something that didn't make too much sense, except maybe inside you? In your stomach somewhere? Something that wasn't smart? I'll bet you have plenty. I'll bet you do. Nobody gets really good without it. And you're good. I know that. She sits up beside him. I don't know why all this has happened to me... ... but I do know that none of it's your fault. I hope you can hear me, because this is how I say I'm sorry. Frank accepts. So... I'm going to go see if I win an Oscar. And I won't worry about it at all. Because I've got you to protect me. Frank almost smiles.

question: You shouldn't be here. Frank laughs. There is a pause. So, you're quitting show business?
answer: Yeah.

question: Too bad. You had talent. What are you going to do?
answer: I thought I might hole up with my dad. Finish that chess game. Rachel nods approvingly.

question: Get him when Fletcher's not around.
answer: That's the idea. Fletcher grins. Rachel starts to cry. So, how's the new guy?

question: He's got white hair, Frank.
answer: He's very good.

question: Why'd you have to get me an old man?
answer: I don't trust you.

question: Yeah... well, give me a kiss and let's get this over with.
answer: 'Bye Rachel. Rachel turns quickly. She almost runs up the boarding ladder. Frank remains watching her. Fletcher looks back over his shoulder as they disappear into the plane.
